snippet: The Exploratorium, which inspired science museums around the world to adopt a hands-on, learning-by-doing ethos, is on the verge of a rebirth.
abstract: Exploratorium, San Francisco science museum designed by Frank Oppenheimer, inspired similar institutions around the world to adopt a hands-on, learning-by-doing ethos; museum will close its current site and open a $200 million facility in 2013, allowing it to triple its exhibition space and expand its focus.
lead_paragraph: The Exploratorium, which inspired science museums around the world to adopt a hands-on, learning-by-doing ethos, is on the verge of a rebirth.

headline.seo: Exploratorium to Reopen on San Francisco Bay in 2013
headline.main: San Francisco Exploratorium to Show New Face in a New Place
headline.print_headline: San Francisco Exploratorium to a Show New Face in a New Place
